         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1604

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the general obligations law, in relation to the implementation
of child support enforcement

PURPOSE OF BILL:
Requires those individuals applying for recreational licenses in New
York State to disclose his or her social security number and state
whether or not they owe child support.

SUMMARY OF SPECIFIC PROVISIONS:
Section 1: includes "recreational activity" in the list of licensed
activities which warrant disclosure of social security number and
child support payment obligations;

Section 2: defines "license" and denotes its application to licenses
for recreational activities;

Section 3: authorizes certain individuals to promulgate regulations on
an emergency basis to ensure the implementation of this act;

Section 4: states this bill shall become effective 60 days after it
shall have become law.

JUSTIFICATION:
As per federal law, in order to receive federal funds states must have
laws in effect which require an applicant for a professional or
occupational license, a driver's license, and a marriage license to
disclose his or her social security number and to certify whether he
or she is under an obligation to pay child support. In 1997, the
federal act was amended to add that states must require these
disclosures when applying for recreational licenses. This bill amends
the General Obligations Law so that it complies with the federal
regulations.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
First introduced in 2003.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None known to the State.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Sixty days after it shall have become law.
